front.p: 1885 November 27: to Hector Museum of New Zealand—Te Papa Tongarewa MU000094/003/0027

body.p: I very much wish to borrow from the Colonial Museum & Library two things:—
1. One of the skeletons of Sphenodon punctatum, (mentioned by Dr. Newman in his paper on this Lizard, Trans. N.Z. Inst., vol.X., p.226):—
2 Günther’s scientific description of the same, in “Phil. Trans., 1867, pp. 595–629, and plates 26–28,” (referred to, as above, by Dr. Günther, at p.9, of “Zoology of Erebus and Terror Expedition”).

I much fear you may not be able to lend me the skeleton, still I venture to hope you may: I would take every care of it & be fully answerable for it (as to value) if lost: at all events I hope you can lend me the book;—& will return it in a few days.

Some bones of a lizard (?) about size of Sphenodon punctatum, have been this week found here, in the quarry below:—though only a few, they are in excellent preservation: I wish to have a description ready for our next meeting: an early reply will oblige.
